Posts.Content: margodae wrote: I recently had genetic testing and found out that I carry a NBN genetic mutation. This is a more recently discovered genetic mutation and there is not a lot of information out there. I have been told that it increases susceptibility to several cancers including breast, ovarian, melanoma, leukemia, and prostate. Has anyone else tested positive for NBN genetic mutation...if so what was recommended for you as far as treatment or increase surveillance? Thanks for any info! margodae Dx 9/11/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: NBN Genetic Mutation...anyone else? margodae margodae

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2010 06:10AM margodae wrote: Thanks for your replies ladies!  I am so glad to hear that the procedure is relatively easy.  It is amazing to hear from everyone that the waiting is definately the hardest part...so true!  It is all I can do to stay busy and distracted some days!  However, I am glad that all of your scans came back clear, which makes the wait worth it.  I am hoping for the same!  Just a few more days...I think I can, I think I can.... margodae
Posts.Title: Bone Scan in 3 days margodae margodae

Posts.Content: margodae wrote: Hey ladies! One month ago tomorrow I noticed a dull ache in my left forearm and wrist.  It is tender to touch with minimal to no swelling.  My oncology nurse ordered a bone scan to be done this week.  I am a nervous wreck!  Has anyone had similar symptoms and/or a bone scan??? Dx 9/11/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bone Scan in 3 days margodae margodae
